text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Province of Teramo | native_name = | native_name_lang = it | settlement_type = Province | image_skyline = Teramo - Duomo 04.jpg | image_alt = Cathedral of Teramo | image_caption = Duomo (cathedral) of Teramo. | image_flag = | flag_alt = | image_shield = Provincia di Teramo-Stemma.svg | shield_alt = Coat of arms of Teramo | image_map = Teramo in Italy.svg | map_alt = Map with the province of Teramo in Italy | map_caption = Map with the province of Teramo, in red, in Italy | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = Abruzzo | established_title = | established_date = | seat_type = Capital | seat = Teramo | parts_type = Comuni | parts_style = para | p1 = 47 | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = President | leader_name = Renzo Di Sabatino | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 1954.38 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 309859 | population_as_of = January 2017 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 64100 | area_code_type = Telephone prefix | area_code = 0861 | iso_code = | registration_plate = TE | blank_name_sec1 = ISTAT | blank_info_sec1 = 067 | website = Official website | footnotes = }} The province of Teramo () is a province in the Abruzzo region of Central Italy. Its capital is the city of Teramo, and the province borders the Adriatic Sea. ==Geography== Teramo is in the northeast of Abruzzo and has an area of , the third largest province in the region after the provinces of L'Aquila and Chieti. The province is bordered to the east by the Adriatic Sea, to the north by the province of Ascoli Piceno (Marche region), to the northwest by the province of Rieti (Lazio region), to the southwest by the province of L'Aquila and to the south by the province of Pescara. The main river in the province is the Vomano, long, that flows into the Adriatic Sea. The highest mountain in the province (and in the Abruzzo region) is Corno Grande (), with an altitude of . ==Population== There are 309,859 persons living in the province (January 2017), for a population density of inhabitants/km². they are: # Alba Adriatica # Ancarano # Arsita # Atri # Basciano # Bellante # Bisenti # Campli # Canzano # Castel Castagna # Castellalto # Castelli # Castiglione Messer Raimondo # Castilenti # Cellino Attanasio # Cermignano # Civitella del Tronto # Colledara # Colonnella # Controguerra # Corropoli # Cortino # Crognaleto # Fano Adriano # Giulianova # Isola del Gran Sasso d'Italia # Martinsicuro # Montefino # Montorio al Vomano # Morro d'Oro # Mosciano Sant'Angelo # Nereto # Notaresco # Penna Sant'Andrea # Pietracamela # Pineto # Rocca Santa Maria # Roseto degli Abruzzi # Sant'Egidio alla Vibrata # Sant'Omero # Silvi # Teramo # Torano Nuovo # Torricella Sicura # Tortoreto # Tossicia # Valle Castellana The largest comune is Teramo, with and the smallest is Nereto, with . Two comuni have less than 300 inhabitantsː Fano Adriano with 288 inhabitants, and Pietracamela with 263 inhabitants. ===Main comuni=== The following table shows the 10 comuni with more inhabitants with their population, and their area and altitude. No. Comune Population (2017) Area (km²) Density Altitude (m) 1 Teramo 152.84 432 2 Roseto degli Abruzzi 53.27 5 3 Giulianova 28.00 68 4 Martinsicuro 14.66 2 5 Silvi 20.63 2 6 Pineto 38.11 4 7 Alba Adriatica 9.60 5 8 Tortoreto 22.97 239 9 Atri 92.18 444 10 Sant'Egidio alla Vibrata 18.36 237 From north to south, the province of Teramo has seven blue flag beaches on the Adriatric Seacoast, called the Seven Sisters; they are: *Martinsicuro *Alba Adriatica *Tortoreto *Giulianova *Roseto degli Abruzzi *Pineto *Silvi ==Gallery== File:PalazzoCastelli.jpg|Palazzo Castelli, Teramo.
